wizardFlow.title: Liberty Bell RTM & CE Eligibility Wizard
wizardFlow.description: Determine your eligibility for Right to Manage (RTM) and Collective Enfranchisement (CE)

q1.question: Is your property a flat or a house?
q1.description: This helps us work out what types of legal rights might apply.

q2_flat.question: Is your flat leasehold?
q2_flat.description: Most flats in England and Wales are leasehold

q2_house.question: Is there a Residents' Management Company (RMC) in place?
q2_house.description: If so, we can help you take it over or improve services. You can usually find this information in your lease or on your most recent service charge invoice.

q3.question: Is there a Residents' Management Company (RMC) or RTM company already in place?
q3.description: If so, we can help you take it over or improve services. You can usually find this information in your lease or on your most recent service charge invoice.

q4.question: How many flats are there in your building?
q4.description: Please enter a number – we need at least 2 to proceed.

q5.question: Are at least two thirds of the flats owned by long leaseholders (original leases longer than 21 years)?

q6.question: Does any one person or company own more than two flats in the building?
q6.description: If they do, their flats can't be counted for certain legal thresholds.

q7a.question: Does your building contain any non residential space?
q7a.description: e.g. shops, restaurants, offices, commercial units, or storage not used by residents

q7b.question: Roughly what proportion of the building is non residential?
q7b.description: Exclude communal areas like stairs or bin stores.

options.label: More than 25% but no more than 50%

q8.question: Was the building originally a house that was later converted into flats?

q9.question: Does the freeholder or one of their family members live in the building now?
q9.description: This affects exemptions for small conversions only.

q10.question: Do at least half of the leaseholders in your building support taking back control – or are likely to once they understand the benefits?
q10.description: We'll show you exactly how to engage your neighbours if you're not sure yet.

eligible_registration.title: Fantastic! You're eligible and ready to move forward.

leaseholder_engagement.title: No worries – we'll show you how to build support and get your neighbours on board.
leaseholder_engagement.message: We can help you engage with other leaseholders in your building.

rmc_process.title: Sounds like there's already a structure in place.
rmc_process.message: We can help you take control of it or make it work better for leaseholders.

ineligible_not_leasehold.title: Unfortunately only leasehold flats can acquire the right to manage.
ineligible_not_leasehold.message: RTM and CE rights only apply to leasehold properties.

ineligible_house_no_rmc.title: Unfortunately we are unable to help as there are no pathways to acquire control of your building.
ineligible_house_no_rmc.message: Right to Manage and Collective Enfranchisement only apply to flats. But if you contribute to an estate charge there could be a Residents Management Company in place.

ineligible_too_much_commercial.title: Unfortunately, buildings with over 50% commercial space aren't eligible for RTM or CE.
ineligible_too_much_commercial.message: The commercial space proportion exceeds the legal limits for these rights.

leaseholder_engagement_module.title: Leaseholder Engagement Module
leaseholder_engagement_module.description: Tools and guidance to help you build support among your neighbours

rmc_process.title: RMC Process
rmc_process.description: Help with taking over or improving existing management structures
